intro: Dendropanax affinis, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its roots are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas.
